p: A 1‐year‐old Labrador presented with acute onset lethargy, neck pain and pyrexia. Six months earlier, a subtotal pericardiectomy had been performed for neutrophilic pericarditis and focal pyogranulomatous epicarditis, from which the dog recovered uneventfully. No abnormalities were detected on pre‐referral thoracic radiographs. Cervical hyperaesthesia and quiet mentation were present on physical examination; there were no neurological deficits. Steroid‐responsive meningitis‐arteritis (SRMA) was suspected. Moderate left‐shifted neutrophilia, hyperglobulinemia and increased C‐reactive protein (CRP) were documented. Infectious disease ( Toxoplasma gondii, Neospora caninum, Dirofilaria immitis, Anaplasma spp., Ehrlichia spp., Borrelia burgdorferi and Angiostrongylus vasorum) testing was negative.
